params.balanceProofs: a `BalanceProofs` struct containing the following: - balancesContainerRoot: The merkle root of the balances container - balancesContainerProof: The merkle proof for the balances container to the beacon block root.    This is 9 witness hashes of 32 bytes each concatenated together starting from the leaf node. - validatorBalanceLeaves: Array of leaf nodes containing the validator balance with three other balances. - validatorBalanceProofs: Array of merkle proofs for the validator balance to the Balances container root.    This is 39 witness hashes of 32 bytes each concatenated together starting from the leaf node.
params.pendingDepositProofs: a `PendingDepositProofs` struct containing the following: - pendingDepositContainerRoot: The merkle root of the pending deposits list container - pendingDepositContainerProof: The merkle proof from the pending deposits list container     to the beacon block root.    This is 9 witness hashes of 32 bytes each concatenated together starting from the leaf node. - pendingDepositIndexes: Array of indexes in the pending deposits list container for each    of the strategy's deposits. - pendingDepositProofs: Array of merkle proofs for each strategy deposit in the    beacon chain's pending deposit list container to the pending deposits list container root.    These are 28 witness hashes of 32 bytes each concatenated together starting from the leaf node.

params._owner: The owner who can request, fail and confirm consolidations
params._validatorRegistrator: The validator registrator who does operations on the old staking strategy

params._sourceStrategy: The address of the old Native Staking Strategy

returns.accountingValid: true if accounting was successful, false if fuse is blown

params._sourceStrategy: The address of the old Native Staking Strategy
params.operatorIds: The operator IDs for the source SSV cluster
params.publicKey: The public key of the validator to exit which must have STAKED state.

params.sourcePubKeys: The public keys of the source validators that failed to be consolidated.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._sourceStrategy: The address of the old Native Staking Strategy
params.cluster: The SSV cluster information for the source validator
params.operatorIds: The operator IDs for the source SSV cluster
params.publicKey: The public key of the validator to remove which must have EXITING or REGISTERED state.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._sourceStrategy: The address of the old Native Staking Strategy
params.sourcePubKeys: The public keys of the validators to be consolidated from the old Native Staking Strategy
params.targetPubKey: The public key of the target validator on the new Compounding Staking Strategy

params.depositAmountGwei: The amount of WETH to stake to the validator in Gwei.
params.validatorStakeData: validator data needed to stake. The `ValidatorStakeData` struct contains the pubkey, signature and depositDataRoot.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.amountGwei: The amount of ETH to be withdrawn from the validator in Gwei. A zero amount is not allowed.
params.publicKey: The public key of the validator

params.balanceProofs: a `BalanceProofs` struct containing the following: - balancesContainerRoot: The merkle root of the balances container - balancesContainerProof: The merkle proof for the balances container to the beacon block root.    This is 9 witness hashes of 32 bytes each concatenated together starting from the leaf node. - validatorBalanceLeaves: Array of leaf nodes containing the validator balance with three other balances. - validatorBalanceProofs: Array of merkle proofs for the validator balance to the Balances container root.    This is 39 witness hashes of 32 bytes each concatenated together starting from the leaf node.
params.pendingDepositProofs: a `PendingDepositProofs` struct containing the following: - pendingDepositContainerRoot: The merkle root of the pending deposits list container - pendingDepositContainerProof: The merkle proof from the pending deposits list container     to the beacon block root.    This is 9 witness hashes of 32 bytes each concatenated together starting from the leaf node. - pendingDepositIndexes: Array of indexes in the pending deposits list container for each    of the strategy's deposits. - pendingDepositProofs: Array of merkle proofs for each strategy deposit in the    beacon chain's pending deposit list container to the pending deposits list container root.    These are 28 witness hashes of 32 bytes each concatenated together starting from the leaf node.

MIN_CONSOLIDATION_PERIOD.details: Minimum time that must pass before a consolidation request can be processed. 256 epochs * 32 slots/epoch * 12 seconds/slot = 98304 seconds (~27 hours) The actual time can be a lot longer than this depending on the number of requests in the beacon chain's pending consolidation queue.

nativeStakingStrategy2.details: The old Native Staking Strategy connected to the second SSV cluster

nativeStakingStrategy3.details: The old Native Staking Strategy connected to the third SSV cluster

confirmConsolidation((bytes32,bytes,byte.notice: Confirm the consolidation of validators from an old Native Staking Strategy to the new Compounding Staking Strategy has been completed.

consolidationStartTimestamp().notice: Timestamp when the consolidation process was requested

doAccounting(address).notice: The validator registrator of the old Native Staking Strategy can call doAccounting

exitSsvValidator(address,bytes,uint64[]).notice: Exit of source validators are allowed during the consolidation process as consolidated validators will be in EXITING state hence can not be consolidated after exit. Only callable by the validator registrator.

failConsolidation(bytes[]).notice: A consolidation request can fail to be processed on the beacon chain for various reasons. For example, the pending consolidation queue is full with 262,144 requests. Or the source validator has exited from a voluntary exit request. This reduces the consolidation count and changes the validator state back to STAKED.

removeSsvValidator(address,bytes,uint64[.notice: Removing source validators is not allowed during the consolidation process as consolidated validators will be in EXITING state hence can not be consolidated after removal. Only callable by the validator registrator.

requestConsolidation(address,bytes[],byt.notice: Request consolidation of validators from an old Native Staking Strategy to the new Compounding Staking Strategy

sourceStrategy().notice: The address of the source Native Staking Strategy being consolidated from

stakeEth((bytes,bytes,bytes32),uint64).notice: Deposits to Compounding Staking Strategy validators that are not the target of a consolidation are allowed. Only the registrator can call this function.

targetPubKeyHash().notice: The public key hash of the target validator on the new Compounding Staking Strategy

validatorRegistrator().notice: Address of the validator registrator account

validatorWithdrawal(bytes,uint64).notice: not allowed during the migration period. Only the registrator can call this function.

verifyBalances((bytes32,bytes,bytes32[],.notice: Anyone can verify balances on the new Compounding Staking Strategy as long as there are no consolidations in progress.

userdoc.notice: Orchestrates the consolidation of validators from old Native Staking Strategies to the new Compounding Staking Strategy.
